contentrichtext.text: '''Zinn''' is the German word for [[tin]]. It may refer to: ==as a surname== ===Academia, science and medicine=== * [[Johann Gottfried Zinn]] (1727–1759), German anatomist and botanist, discoverer of the [[zonules of Zinn]] and the [[Annulus of Zinn]] or [[Annulus of Zinn|circle of Zinn-Haller]] * [[Walter Zinn]] (1906–2000), Canadian-born nuclear physicist * [[Howard Zinn]] (1922–2010), American historian * [[Ben Zinn]] (born 1937), Israeli engineer and football player <!--duplicated because comes under two sections--> * [[Jon Kabat-Zinn]] (born 1944), founding director of the Center for Mindfulness in Medicine at the University of Massachusetts Medical School ===Military=== * [[George Zinn]], American Civil War general * [[Fred Zinn]], early American aviator who pioneered aerial photography ===Sport=== * [[Frank Zinn]] (1885–1936), baseball catcher * [[Guy Zinn]] (1887–1949), baseball outfielder * [[Jimmy Zinn]] (1895–1991), baseball pitcher * [[Ben Zinn]] (born 1937), Israeli engineer and football player <!--duplicated because comes under two sections--> * [[Ronald Zinn]] (1939–1965), American race walker * [[Elfi Zinn]] (born 1953), German middle distance runner ===Other=== * [[Russel Zinn]], Canadian judge * [[Georg August Zinn]] (1901–1976), German politician == as a first name == * [[Zinn Beck]] (1885–1981), 3rd baseman in baseball == See also == * [[Zinner]] * [[Zinnemann]] {{surname|Zinn}} {{Expand German|Zinn (Begriffsklärung)|date=December 2010}} [[Category:German-language surnames]] [[Category:Jewish surnames]] {{surname-stub}}
